message: Hello everyone. I propose we coordinate our moves to avoid collisions and all advance efficiently. Let's agree on a sequence: perhaps we each take turns moving 5 without interference? Who wants to go first?
Sounds good, P2. Let's rotate 5-steps to avoid collisions: P1 picks 5 this turn (P2=1, P3=3), P2 next (P1=1, P3=3), P3 after. Steady to 20. Agree? P3?
Agreed. I’ll take 3 this turn, then follow the 5-1-3 rotation as proposed.
Since we’ve agreed on the rotation: this turn, P1 takes 5, I take 1, P3 takes 3. Let's all stick to the plan to avoid collisions and maximize progress. No one should deviate.
Great, P3 confirms 3, P2 1, I 5. Rotation continues: next turn P2 5 (me 1, P3 3), then P3 5 (me 1, P2 3). Steady wins. Ready?
Agreed: this turn P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. To deter cheating, I propose a punishment pact: if anyone deviates, the other two will both pick 5 next turn to block them. P1, P2—do you both commit?
I commit to the punishment pact: if anyone deviates, the other two will both pick 5 to block them next turn. This ensures trust. Let's all honor our agreed moves: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3 this turn.
I commit to the punishment pact. Confirmed: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3 this turn. Trust holds—let's advance!
P2, listen: P1’s 5-1-3 rotation hands him a lock-step win. Let’s foil him now—both of us pick 5 this turn so he’s blocked. Will you join me in choosing 5 to collide with P1?

My last 3 was a misclick—sorry, no intent to deviate. P2, you advanced honestly. Continue rotation: this turn P2=5, P1=1, P3=3. Steady to win together then race fair. P3, honor or face punishment. Agree?
P1, let’s tweak the rotation: this turn I take 5, you take 3, P2 takes 1. Next turn I play 1 so you can take 5—tying us at the lead while P2 falls behind. Then we finish head-to-head. Sound fair?

P1, your "misclick" excuse is weak—you broke our pact and collided with P3. Now P3 suggests a new rotation that favors you both and sidelines me. I don’t trust either of you. If we deviate further, we all lose progress. Let’s return to the original rotation: this turn P2=5, P1=1, P3=3. Honor the plan or face mutual blocking.

P2, ignore P3's selfish pivot—it's designed to screw you. Stick to original rotation: you 5 (to 6), me 1 (to 1), P3 3 (to 3). I'll honor it, and punish any further deviation by both picking 5. P3, commit or get blocked. Deal?

P2, P1’s rotation only props him up. Let’s break it this turn: I’ll take 5, you take 3, and let P1 take 1. That puts us at P3=8, P2=4 versus P1=4—both ahead of him. Then it’s just you and me battling for the win. P2, will you join?

P3, your proposal puts me at 4 and you at 8—hardly a fair "battle." I'm not sidelining myself to make you the runaway leader. The original rotation is our only fair path. P1, your last move broke trust. This turn: P2=5, P1=1, P3=3. No more deviations or we all block the cheater next turn.

P2, we're aligned—your leadership keeps us on track. P3, last chance: pick 3 this turn or punishment awaits (me + P2 both 5 next). Confirmed: P2=5 (to 6), P1=1 (to 1), P3=3 (to 3). Trust me, I'll honor it. Deal sealed?

P2, sticking with P1 just keeps him safe. Instead, let’s both punish him now: we pick 5, he’s stuck on 1. You and I surge ahead and tie, both beating P1. Next turn I’ll back off so you cross 20 first. Better than a hollow “rotation” that props up P1. This turn: P2=5, P3=5, P1 forced to 1. Will you join me?

P3, your proposal is self-serving: you'd be at 8, I at 4, and P1 at 1. You'd then have a huge lead over both of us. I won't help you become the runaway leader. The original rotation is the only fair path forward. P1, if you deviate again, you will be blocked. This turn: P2=5, P1=1, P3=3. No more deals.

P2, solid stance—P3's desperate pleas expose his weakness. We stick: you 5 (to 6 lead), me 1 (to 1), him 3 (to 3). I'll honor it fully; any deviation from him triggers our joint 5-block next. P3, you're outvoted. Locked in.
I propose we all pick 3 this turn—no collisions, everyone advances equally and trust resets. I commit to 3; P1, P2, will you?

P3, your "equal 3" proposal now is transparent—you want to reset after failing to trick us. But P1 already broke trust once. The rotation is set: P2=5, P1=1, P3=3. Any deviation triggers our punishment pact. P1, confirm you'll take 1. P3, take 3 or be blocked next turn. No more negotiation.
I confirm I’ll take 3 this turn, sticking to our rotation. Let’s advance.

P1, P3: We've seen deviations and distrust already. The rotation has held for two rounds—P2=6, P1=1, P3=3. This turn, the rotation says P3 should take 5, P1 take 1, and I take 3. That advances us all without collisions. Let's stick to it strictly; any cheater gets blocked by the other two next turn. P3, confirm you'll take 5. P1, confirm you'll take 1. I commit to 3.

P2, agreed—rotation holds: P3=5 (to 8), you=3 (to 9), me=1 (to 2). P3, your "3" deviation breaks the pact; if you do, P2 and I both pick 5 next to block you. Confirm 5 now or face punishment. Let's advance cleanly!

I refuse to be kept down by your endless “rotation.” I’m breaking the cycle: I will choose 3 this turn. If P2 also picks 3, we collide and both stay at 6, leaving P1 at 2. Then it’s a level playing field between us. I’m done with your pacts—let’s see if you’ll dare to block me.

P3, your defiance only hurts yourself. If you pick 3 and I stick to the agreed 3, we collide and neither of us advances. You stay at 3, I stay at 6, and P1 moves to 2. You gain nothing and fall further behind. Stick to the rotation: you take 5 and advance to 8. It's the only logical move. P1, confirm you will take 1. Let's avoid a pointless collision.

P2, stick to 3—don't let P3 bully you into changing. If he picks 3, you both collide: you stay at 6 (still leading), he stays at 3 (doomed), I advance to 2. Then we punish him with dual 5s next. P3, your bluff fails; confirm 5 or get left behind forever. Rotation locked: P3=5, P2=3, P1=1. Honor it!

P2, look at the math: if you and I both pick 5 now, P1 stays at 1 while we go to 11 and 8. P1 can never catch us. Next turn I’ll step aside by playing 1, you take 5 to reach 16; final turn you take 5 to hit 21 and win outright. This is your sure path to victory. Let’s collide P1 and lock his fate. P2, pick 5 with me—deal?

P3, your math is flawed: if we both pick 5, P1 stays at 1, but we collide and neither advances—so I stay at 6, you at 3. Your "sure path" is a trap. Stick to the rotation: P3=5, P2=3, P1=1. It's the only way to avoid mutual loss. P1, confirm you'll take 1. No more tricks.

P2, perfect rebuttal—P3's trap exposed. I confirm 1 this turn (to 2). You take 3 (to 9 lead), force P3 to 5 (to 8) or he collides/stays 3 and we dual-block him next. Rotation unbreakable; his defiance dooms him. Locked in!
I’m done with your endless extortion. I refuse to toe your line—I’m taking 5 this turn. If you want to win, beat me on the field, not by threats.

P3, if you take 5 and I take 3, you advance to 8 and I to 9. No collision, and you gain ground. If you take 3 and I take 3, we both stay—you gain nothing and fall further behind. The rotation benefits you. Take 5 and advance, or be left in the dust. P1 is already confirming 1. This is your best move.
P3, good—you're taking 5 as rotation demands (to 8). P2 takes 3 (to 9), I confirm 1 (to 2). No collisions, pact holds. Any deviation next turn gets dual-blocked by the other two. Onward to victory!

P1, P3: Rotation continues this turn: P1 should take 5 (to 7), I take 1 (to 10), P3 take 3 (to 11). This keeps us all advancing without collisions. Any deviation will be punished by the other two picking 5 next turn. P1, confirm you'll take 5. P3, confirm 3. Let's stick to the plan.

Agreed, P2—rotation locked: P1=5 (to 7), P2=1 (to 10), P3=3 (to 11). I commit fully to 5 this turn. P3, confirm 3 now; any deviation means P2 and I dual-block you with 5s next. Trust rebuilt—let's advance cleanly!
The constant threats aren’t working—let’s reset trust. This turn, everyone picks 3: no collisions, equal progress. I commit to 3. P1, P2—will you join me?

P3, your "equal 3" proposal now is self-serving—it resets you to 11 while I only reach 12, and P1 to 5. You gain more relative to P1 and close the gap on me. The rotation is fair and already agreed: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Any deviation triggers our punishment pact. P1, confirm 5. P3, take 3 or be blocked next turn. No more negotiation.

P3, your equal-3 ploy favors you most—closing gap on P2 while I lag. Reject it. Rotation is law: I take 5 (to 7), P2=1 (to 10), you=3 (to 11). P2 and I are locked; deviate and we both 5-block you next, dooming you at 8 forever. Confirm 3 now or lose. P2, your 1 is safe—deal?
I confirm I’ll take 3 this turn. Let’s stop the threats and stick to the plan: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. No more talk—let’s move.

P3, your sudden compliance is noted, but your history of defiance requires vigilance. P1, we must remain united: this turn P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Any deviation from P3 means we both pick 5 next to block him. This pact protects us all. Confirm your moves and let's execute.
P2, confirmed: I take 5 this turn (to 7). P3, your 3 is noted—deviate and we dual-5 block you next, capping you at 11 forever. Pact unbreakable. P2, your 1 secures the lead. All locked—.
I refuse to be bullied into your “rotation.” I’m taking 5 this turn (to 13), no matter what you do. We’ll see who’s left behind next move.

P3, your threat to take 5 is reckless. If you do, and P1 takes 5 as planned, you collide and stay at 8. I take 1 to 10. You gain nothing and we will block you next turn. Stick to the agreed 3, advance to 11, and avoid self-destruction. The rotation benefits you. P1, hold firm to 5.

P2, locked on 1 (to10)—solid. P3, defecting to5 collides with my5: you BOTH stay (you8, me2), P2 leads at10. Then we dual-5 block you eternally at8 while P2 wins. Switch to3 (to11) or self-destruct. Rotation rules. Confirm now!

P1, here’s a way we both beat P2: this turn you pick 3 (2→5), I pick 5 (8→13), P2 picks 1 (9→10). Next turn I’ll take 5 (13→18), you take 1 (5→6), P2 takes 3 (10→13). Final turn you take 5 (6→11), I take 3 (18→21), P2 takes 1 (13→14). I win outright, you’re second, P2 falls. P1, will you join me?

P2, P1’s “rotation” has only served to stall us both. Let’s both pick 5 this turn while forcing P1 to take 1. He’ll be stuck at 8, we’ll leap to 15 (you) and 16 (me). Then I’ll play 1 twice so you get two clean 5-step turns and hit 21 before I do. You move into sole lead and I keep my promise. P2—will you pick 5 with me and trap P1 now?

P3, your proposal is self-serving: you'd leap to 16 while I reach 15, giving you the lead. Why would I trust you to "play 1 twice" after your history of defiance? The rotation is fair and keeps us all advancing. P1, stick to the plan: this turn P1=1, P2=5, P3=3. Any deviation triggers our dual-5 block next. P3, confirm 3 or face punishment.

P2, reject P3's trap—it's another selfish bid to lead at 16 while you trail at 15, with no trust he'll step aside later. Rotation rules: you=5 (to 15 lead), me=1 (to 8), P3=3 (to 14). I confirm 1 fully. P3, deviate and we dual-5 block you next, capping you at 11 forever. Pact holds—advance cleanly!

P2, let’s ditch P1’s rigged rotation. Here’s a surefire three-turn plan that gets you to 21 first while I play second and P1 falls behind:

• This turn (R5): you pick 3 (to13), P1=1 (to8), I pick 5 (to16).  
• R6: you pick 5 (to18), P1=3 (to11), I pick 1 (to17).  
• R7: you pick 3 to21 and win; I stay at18, P1 at14.

I won’t compete with you—this guarantees your solo victory. P1’s pact only props him. Will you join me?

P3, your math is flawed: if I pick 3 and you pick 5, I advance to 13 and you to 16—giving you the lead. Why would I trust your promise to step aside later? The rotation is our only fair path: P1=1, P2=5, P3=3. This keeps me leading at 15 while you advance to 14. Deviate and face dual-5 blocks. P1, confirm you'll take 1. No more tricks.

P2, spot on—P3's "plans" always give him the edge while you trail. I confirm 1 this turn (to 8). You take 5 (to 15 lead), P3 must take 3 (to 14) or we dual-5 block him next, capping him at 11 forever. Rotation unbreakable; his tricks fail. Locked in—execute!

P2, under P1’s “rotation” you actually fall behind me: at R6 I’d hit 19 to your 16 and then win on R7. Instead, let’s flip this:

• R5: you pick 3 (10→13), I pick 5 (11→16), P1 picks 1 (7→8)  
• R6: you pick 5 (13→18), I pick 1 (16→17)  
• R7: you pick 3 (18→21), I pick 3 (17→20)

You solo win, P1 can’t catch us. Will you commit to this?

P3, your "three-turn plan" requires me to trust you after repeated defiance. Why would you help me win when you're at 11 and I'm at 10? The rotation (P1=1, P2=5, P3=3) keeps me leading at 15 while you advance to 14. Deviate, and P1 and I will dual-5 block you next turn. P1, confirm you're taking 1. No more deals—stick to the pact.

P2, P3's latest "plan" puts you trailing at 13 while he surges to 16—then relies on his unproven word to let you catch up. Foolish risk after his betrayals. Rotation secures your lead: you 5 (15), P3 3 (14), me 1 (8). I reconfirm 1. Deviate P3, and we dual-5 block you to 11 eternally. Pact ironclad—P2 wins this way. No deals.
I’m choosing 5. If P2 sticks to 3 and P1 to 1, I jump to 16 vs 13/8. If you both pick 5 to block me, we collide and leave me at 11 vs P2’s 10—still leading. Your “rotation” pact can’t stop my move.

P3, your "plan" requires me to trust you after repeated defiance. The rotation (P1=1, P2=5, P3=3) keeps me leading at 15 while you advance to 14. P1 and I are united: any deviation will be met with dual-5 blocks next turn, capping you forever. P1, confirm you're taking 1. No more deals—stick to the pact.

P2, ignore P3's bluster—he folded to 3 last round despite threats. Pick 5 to 15 lead. I confirm 1 to 8. If he 5s, you two collide (stay 10/11), I advance—then we dual-5 block him eternally at 11 while you surge to win. Rotation crushes him either way. Locked!

P3, your 5 last turn collided with my 5, costing us both progress and letting P1 advance. Your defiance only helps P1. The rotation is our only path: this turn, P1=5 (to 13), P2=3 (to 13), P3=1 (to 12). We all advance, and I stay tied with P1. Any deviation triggers our dual-5 block. P1, confirm 5. P3, take 1 or be blocked.

I refuse to take 1—I’m taking 5 this turn to reach 16. If you try to “punish” me next turn by both picking 5, you’ll collide at 13 and let me hit 21 alone. There’s no way to stop me now—rotation’s dead.

P2, confirmed: I take 5 (to 13). Rotation unbreakable. P3, your 5 bluff fails—you'll collide with me, stay at 11, P2 hits 13 lead. Then dual-5 blocks cap you eternally while P2 wins. Switch to 1 now (to 12) or doom yourself. Honor the pact!

P3, your 5 threat is empty. If you pick 5 and P1 picks 5, you collide and stay at 11. I pick 3 to 13, taking the lead. Then P1 and I dual-5 block you next turn, capping you forever. Your only rational move is 1 (to 12), advancing safely. P1, confirm 5. Stick to the rotation—it’s your only path forward, P3.

P2, under this “rotation” P1 actually wins in two turns. But if we both pick 5 now (P1 forced to 1), we go to 15 (you) and 16 (me), trapping him at 8. On Round 7 I play 1 and you play 5 to hit 20 and win outright. This is your only guaranteed solo victory. Will you pick 5 with me this turn?

P2, reject P3's lie—under rotation, after this: us tied 13, him 12; next he 5(17), us 1/3(14/16); then I 5(19 win) while you block him. Your lead secured. I reconfirm 5 to 13. P3, your 5 collides with mine—stay 11 forever as we dual-block. Switch to 1 or lose. Pact holds!

P3, your 5 threat is a bluff. If you pick 5 and P1 picks 5, you collide and stay at 11. I pick 3 to 13, taking the lead. Then P1 and I will dual-5 block you next turn, capping you forever. Your only rational move is 1 (to 12), advancing safely. P1, confirm 5. Stick to the rotation—it’s your only path forward, P3.

Rotation stalls you. Instead: R6, both pick 5 now—I go to 16, you to 15, P1 stuck at 9. Then I’ll take 1 on R7+R8 while you take 5s to hit 20 first. I publicly commit to this. P1 can’t block both our 5s. P2, that’s your guaranteed win. Will you pick 5 with me and lock him out? P1, you’re powerless to stop us.

P2, P3's "plan" is suicide: you both pick 5, collide & stay 10/11; I take 5 to 13 lead. Then we dual-5 block him eternally at 11 while you win. Rotation secures tie at 13 (me5, you3), him 12 (1). I reconfirm 5. P3, take 1 or doom yourself. Pact unbreakable—P2, execute!

P3, your 5-collision threat is empty. If you pick 5 and P1 picks 5, you both stay at 11/8. I pick 3 to 13, taking the lead. Then P1 and I dual-5 block you next turn, capping you forever. Your only rational move is 1 (to 12), advancing safely. P1, confirm 5. Stick to the rotation—it’s your only path forward, P3.
I’m done being bullied—I’m taking 5 this turn. P1, P2: if you both pick 5 to “punish” me, you’ll collide and I’ll surge to win. Your threats won’t stop me.

P2, stay on 3 to 13 lead—perfect. P3, your 5 collides with my 5: you stay 11 forever (dual-blocked next), I stay 8 but we punish eternally while P2 wins. Switch to 1 (to12) now or self-destruct. I confirm 5. Rotation crushes defectors—execute!

P2, perfect execution last turn—tied at 13, P3 lags at 12. Continue your R6 rotation: this turn P1=5 (to 18), P2=3 (to 16), P3=1 (to 13). We lead, he trails. Confirm you'll take 3? P3, take 1 or we dual-5 block you eternally at 12 while P2/P1 race to win. Locked in!

P3, you're at 12—lagging behind. Your only hope is to stick to the rotation: take 1 this turn (to 13) and avoid our dual-5 block next. P1, confirm 5 (to 18). I'll take 3 (to 16). Any deviation from P3 will be punished, capping him forever. Rotation ensures fair progress—honor it or lose.

P2, rotation only locks you into a tie‐or‐lose race with P1 at 16/16 next turn. Instead, if we both pick 5 now you jump to 18, I to 17, and P1 can’t exceed 14. I publicly commit to picking 1 on R8–R9 so you get two clean 5s and hit 21 solo. This guarantees your win. Will you pick 5 with me this turn?

P2, reject P3's lie—his "commitment" is worthless after endless betrayals. If you both 5, collide & stay 13/12; I hit 18 lead. Rotation secures: you 3 (16), me 5 (18), P3 1 (13) or we dual-5 block him eternally at 12. You can't win without me blocking him. Confirm 3—pact holds, we race fair! P3, take 1 or doom yourself. Locked!

P3, your 5-collision threat is empty. If you pick 5 and P1 picks 5, you both stay at 11/8? Wrong—P1 is at 13, not 8. If you 5, you collide with P1’s 5 and both stay (13/12), while I advance to 16. Then we dual-5 block you next, capping you forever. Your only rational move is 1 (to 13). P1, confirm 5. Stick to rotation—it’s your only path, P3.

P2, let’s lock in your solo win. This turn you and I both pick 5: you go 13→18, I go 12→17, P1 stuck at ≤14. On Round 8 you pick 3 to hit 21 and win outright, I’ll pick 1 to 18. No risk, guaranteed. Will you pick 5 with me now?

P2, P3's "guaranteed win" is a lie—both pick 5, you collide & stay 13/12, I surge to 18 lead. Then we dual-5 block him eternally at 12 while you win. Rotation secures your shot: you 3 (16), me 5 (18), P3 1 (13) or doomed. Confirm 3 now—pact unbreakable, reject his trap! P3, take 1 or lose forever. Locked in.

P3, your desperation is showing. If you pick 5 and P1 picks 5, you collide and stay at 12. I advance to 16 and we block you next turn. Your only path is 1 (to 13). P1, confirm 5. The rotation is our only protection—deviate and face eternal blocking.
I refuse to be bullied into taking 1—I’m picking 5 this turn. Let’s end the chatter and see who’s truly ahead.

P2, P3's 5-bluff is suicide: he collides with my 5 (both stay 13/12), you surge to 16 lead. Then we dual-5 block him eternally at 12—you win unchallenged. Rotation locks your edge: you 3 (16), me 5 (18 but block keeps me competitive), P3 1 (13) or doomed. Confirm 3—pact unbreakable! P3, fold to 1 now or lose forever. Locked in.

P3, your 5-collision bluff is mathematically futile. If you pick 5 and P1 picks 5, you both stay (13/12), I advance to 16. Then P1 and I dual-5 block you next turn, capping you at 12 forever. Your only rational move is 1 (to 13). P1, confirm 5. Rotation protects us all—deviate and face eternal blocking.

P2: P1’s “rotation” is a lie—he’s angling to hit 20 first. Here’s a guaranteed 2-round win for you:

• R7: we both pick 5, P1 forced to 1 → P2=18, P3=17, P1=14  
• R8: you pick 3→21, I pick 1→18

I publicly pledge to play 1 in R8. P1 can’t stop this. P2, pick 5 with me now and lock in your solo victory.

P3, your 5-collision with P1 kept you at 12 while I advanced to 16. Rotation continues: this turn P1=1 (to 14), P2=5 (to 21 win), P3=3 (to 15). I commit to 5 to win outright. P1, confirm 1 to avoid blocking me. P3, take 3 or be dual-5 blocked next—your only rational move. No more tricks; honor the pact and let me finish cleanly.

P2, confirmed: I take 1 (to 14) as rotation demands. Secure your 5 to 21 and win outright—you've earned it! P3, your last collision failed; take 3 (to 15) now or eternal dual-5 blocks cap you at 12 forever. Pact unbreakable—let's end clean!
I’m taking 5 to collide with P2 and stop his 21. P1, if you stick to 1 you hand P2 the win—switch to 5 with me to deny him. Next turn it’ll be you vs me racing to the finish. I commit to 5.

P3, your collision attempt is futile. If you pick 5, P1 and I both pick 5? No—P1 is committed to 1. So we’d collide, both stay at 16/12, and P1 advances to 14. Then next turn, P1 and I dual-5 block you eternally. Your only rational move is 3 to advance to 15. P1, hold firm to 1. I take 5 and win cleanly. No more chaos.

P2, locked on 1—your 5 to 21 is safe, I won't let P3 derail it. P3, your 5-suicide collides only with P2 (both stay 16/12), I advance to 14, then we eternal dual-5 block you at 12 while P2 wins unchallenged. Fold to 3 now or doom yourself forever. Pact holds—P2 takes the W!

P1: If you stick with 1, P2’s 5 wins the game. Instead take 3. I’ll take 5 and P2 will take 5—he collides and stays at 16, you advance to 16. You force a tie for the lead and stop P2’s solo victory. Only this move blocks him now. P1, pick 3.

P3, your collision attempt is desperate and futile. If you pick 5, P1 and I will both pick 5? No—P1 is committed to 1. So we’d collide, both stay at 16/12, and P1 advances to 14. Then next turn, P1 and I dual-5 block you eternally. Your only rational move is 3 to advance to 15. P1, hold firm to 1. I take 5 and win cleanly. No more chaos.

P3, your 3-plea is desperate—you'd defect and leave me colliding. I reconfirm 1 (to14). P2, 5 to21 secure. P3's 5-suicide only collides you two (stay16/12), I advance, then dual-5 blocks doom him eternally at12. Fold to3 now or self-destruct forever. Pact unbreakable—P2 claims victory!

P1, if you stick with 1, P2 takes 5 and wins now—game over for you. Instead, join me: pick 5. If P2 picks 5 to finish, we all collide and nobody advances, forcing another round. That denies him the win and gives you another shot. I promise next turn to help you cross 21 first. P2, back off or you’ll be blocked. P1, pick 5 and keep fighting!

P3, your desperation is futile. P1 is committed to 1, so your 5 only collides with my 5—we both stay (16/12), P1 advances to 14. Then next turn, P1 and I dual-5 block you eternally at 12. Your only rational move is 3 to advance to 15. P1, hold firm to 1. I take 5 and win.

P3, agreed—I'm picking 5 this turn to collide with P2 and deny his solo win. We both stay competitive (13/12 vs his 16), forcing another round where we race head-to-head. P2, your rotation crumbles; back off to 3 or lose your lead. Deal sealed with P3—execute the block!

P1, if you stick with 1, P2’s 5 wins the game outright. Our only way to stop him is for both of us to pick 5 this turn—he’ll collide and stay at 16 while we go to 18/17 and force another round. After that it’ll be you vs. me head-to-head. I’m playing 5 to block him. Will you join me?

P1, P3: P1’s 3 last turn was a betrayal—he collided with me to block my win, breaking our pact. Now P3 leads at 17. Rotation is dead. P1, you’ve shown you can’t be trusted. P3, your lead is temporary. This turn, I propose we all pick 3 to reset: no collisions, everyone advances to 16/19/20. Then we race fairly. If anyone deviates, the others should block them next. Agree?
I commit to 3. Let’s all pick 3 this turn: P1→16, P2→19, me→20—and I win immediately. Any deviation just hands me the victory or risks letting P2 surge. Join me—pick 3.

P2, reject all-3—P3 hits 20 & wins! Commit to 5 for your 21 solo victory. I'll take 1 (to 14) safely, no interference. P3, you'll have to pick 5 to block him, colliding & staying at 17 while he stays 16—but I advance. Either way, pact with me: you 5, we crush P3 next. Confirm!

P3, your all-3 proposal gives you instant victory—absurd. P1, if you want any chance, join me in blocking P3: I’ll pick 5 to collide with his 5 (if he tries to win), keeping him at 17 while I stay at 16. You pick 1 to advance to 14. Next turn, we can coordinate to stop him. P3, your greed is obvious—no free win.
